newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares end firm, mirroring Wall St.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares end firm, mirroring Wall St.

text.p: Inspired by Wall Street's recovery after Thursday's slide, Chilean blue chips ended stronger with drug-maker LabChile among leading gainers, said traders.
The bolsa is expected to open steady with the market looking to recover its footing after several erratic sessions, they said.
"We expect volume to be flat, although prices could rise gently at the start of the week," said one dealer.
The 40-share index ended up 0.44 percent at 116.07 points.
The general index gained 0.01 percent to 5,340.53 points.
Turnover remained steady at 14.7 billion pesos, with the healthy turnover reflecting revived interest from foreign investors and steady buying from local institutional players.
Traders said the bolsa's mild rebound indicated that the market has found support at 115 points.
Chile's largest pharmaceutical company LabChile surged on news the company has signed a $60 million syndicated loan to repay short-term debts, said dealers.
Its stock rose 2.35 percent to 435 pesos.
Other rises included telecom Entel, up 1.43 percent at 2,840 pesos, and power utility Chilgener, which gained 1.1 percent to 2,750 pesos.
Losers included copper products maker Madeco, down 2.14 percent at 1,145 pesos, and glass producer Cristales , which shed 0.7 percent to 2,850 pesos.
